reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overview:Rust may seem just another average, run-of-the mill multiplayer survival early access title you see pop up on Steam every now and then, and for the most part, you'd be right. However, seeing the vast community that Rust has managed to put together, and seeing it on sale, I decided to give it a go, and boy, do I have a tale to tell! This game is both good, great, and horrible at the same time. Keep reading to understand why.
Worth Noting: I won't talk about really specific things as they are always subject to change. This will be a review of the overall experience you will get out of the game.

The Pros:Great Maps - Each server has it's own procedural map (which you can see here[playrust.io]) and it is pretty huge. Plenty of nice landscapes, biomes and landmarks to explore. With different spreading of resources and rare goods spots.

Powerful Crafting - Crafting is intuitive, takes time to do, and offers many items to choose from, and even more to risk your life gathering ingredients for. Brings the balance between a sandbox builder and shooter. Building your base is also a pleasant experience once you've gathered the resources.

The Social Aspect - If you don't have friends that play rust, you're pretty much doomed if you can't join a clan or small group. Rust is ruthless, with players jumping at each-others' necks for survival. You will be hunted, harassed, and you are expected to do the same, lest you risk being killed yourself. Teamwork and lack of trust in strangers are emphasized and crucially important here.

Intense fights! - When people get greedy, they tend to rely on others to do the hard work for them. Enter raiding bases, and defending your own. If you happen to be online when you are attacked, raids are blood-pumping, scary, but also tons of fun, no matter on which side of the wall you are. Guns, crossbows and explosives everywhere!

Strategy Based - Rust rewards brain over brawn. If you can make a good base design, place your home somewhere strategic, kill enemies from cover, or even deceive them, trap them etc. brings a whole world of rewards and will keep you alive for longer than flailing your assault rifle.

Bi-weekly Updates - Even though this game has been in Alpha for 2 years now, updates are rolling in about two times a week, and it's nice to see a steady development flow. Still, it may be unfinished for a long time, but definitely playable nonetheless.

Modded Servers - Want to freebuild? Want to get all resources and just focus on killing? There are a lot of community hosted servers with mods just for that!
The Cons:Ruthless! - Every one will try to kill you on sight, no questions asked. Everyone will try to raid your base, even though you just started. You will end up entering the game only to find everything you had stolen and your based turned to ruins. I myself with a group of 3 other friends just lost 50 hours of playtime each to an overnight raid, which brings me to my next point:

Raiding is too easy! - Once you get your hands on a few C4 and / or rockets, raiding becomes too easy to perform and too hard to defend against. In order to have a well defended base, you will need to sacrifice actual inside room, if you want to actually be able to build it. Offline raiding (attacking once the players are offline) is also sadly available. You may have lookout towers and a lot of guns. But with no one to operate them, you will lose 100%.

Building Sucks! - I said it's fun, and it is, but in order to combat abuse, you are only allowed to remove structures you placed 10 minutes after you place them. If you notice a mistake, or if you want to expand the building and say, replace a wall with a door, then tough luck, buddy! You'll have to raid your own base. So, start small, think in advance, stack resources and only build once you know what you want!
Conclusion:I recommend this game. It's fun, and it's frustrating, but it's fun because it is frustrating. Don't be afraid to lose, and try to have fun! This game is great with friends, and it has a very large community built around it!

Early Access Disclaimer:As with all Early Access titles I review, I urge the reader to consider that this is an unfinished product and it can change for the best or for the worst during development. Unless you are happy about the current state of the game, or want to support the developers, then do not purchase this game. You run the risk of not liking it later / being abandoned, and you will have only yourself to blame.
If you enjoyed this review and want to see more of my work, consider joining my group and follow my curator page! Link to the right!Jad's List - Curator Group

Bought this game after it was recommended to me by a Steam friend; huge mistake.

What convinced me to buy Rust was the allure of promises which have been revealed to be half-hearted. From what I know, this game had something going in its previous incarnation, now called Legacy. That is no longer the case.

It took no expense of time for me to realize that Rust is a prime contributor to the disgustingly lucrative business of perpetual alpha, money-grubbing early access survival games. They are very efficient at exciting the imaginations of customers with the prospect of what could" be without ever fulfilling that potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-The Story of Rust-
Your eyes are blurry, and you feel light-headed. You awaken to see a field, there are deer and other creatures walking around.  A tiny chicken struts by as your vision becomes more clear... next to it you notice a rock. You pick up this rock and stare at it intensely, it becomes your new best friend. You stand up with rock in hand and realize... you're in the post-apocalyptic world. You look into the distance to see the remains of civilization. Where did the grand cities go? Where are the roads and people? Where are your pants?

You continue to look around in a daze, holding your rock close. You decide you cannot sit around any longer, and start walking forward. You head forwards a road you spotted earlier. On your way to the road, you notice a pile of wood. You run towards it, smashing it with your rock. Wood falls beneath your feet. You eat it. You continue to walk, now noticing a big, shiny rock. You repeat the same process. You now have a supply of wood, rocks, and metal fragments. You wonder what you can do with those. As you get lost in thought, you realize you've made it to the road, but something is wrong... Bears and wolves with a red coat start chasing you. You run at high speeds, swinging your rock in defense... Is this the end?

You continue to defend yourself, realizing your rock has betrayed you. It does not affect the crazed animals. You continue to run, but they will not stop. You strain your eyes and see something ahead, a shelter! You seem to have no stamina so you sprint to this shelter for protection from the animals. The shelter is a cluster of buildings, seeming to be an old town... you're overwhelmed with joy as you notice the animals giving up, wait though... You feel dizzy, sick, and odd... You realize you're getting radiation poisoning!

This will not be the end. You see boxes inside your shelter, you run to them and dig... you're lucky! There are rad-pills! You take these pills and instantly feel better... you abandon the town and continue down the road. You start feeling a cold sensation, you realize... it is turning night. You hurry into the mountains to build your first home to survive the night. As you climb, you slip... and fall. You break your kankles. As you're injured you lay in agony, wondering if this is how your life will end... 5 seconds later you recover and continue ahead.

You make it to the top, overlooking the lush landscape. You cough up your wood from earlier and mold it into the shape of a shelter, and you place it into the dirt below. You walk inside, building a campfire to stay warm... as you fall asleep. You suddenly wake up to the sound of gunshots.... Where could these come from? How? Isn't everyone living like cavemen? You realize this is a very bad sign and decide to leave your shelter behind and run for your life.

You will not stop running. You run, and run, and run... until you find a backpack. You stare at it in awe... and cannot contain yourself. You open up the backpack, and pull out a saliva covered rock, with a stick tied to it... it looks alot like a hatchet. You take it and run into the distance, your primal instincts telling you to hit more wood piles and big rocks... and so you follow your instincts.

You slap, and slap, and slap all the resources you see in sight. Something is very wrong though, you realize you're starving to death. You must find food fast! You run into the woods and see a boar. You run towards the boar, brutally beating it to death with your hatchet. As you gather food from it, you realize it is fresh, raw, chicken meat. You eat it raw, not remembering how to function like a normal human being, and you throw up for hours... What has your life come to?

You finally recover from your sickness. Now you will cook this chicken" you have obtained. You spit up all of the rocks you've collected so far

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rust is such an interesting game. It's a very original concept, having to survive from literally nothing, and building yourself and your clan up to be the strongest in the server. Only, there's several major problems with this game, and that's why I can't reccomend it.

Concept: Like I said, when I first started the game, I loved the concept, from nothing to riches and power. However, when you get into the specifics, there's really no end game. You either build yourself up enough to be strong and not be radied (boring) or, you become the raiders (which almost always stops being for fun and turns ugly and volitile.) So essentially, this game unintentionally breeds a bad community. Also, there are far more chances to lose than their are to win. You either are the strongest and don't get raided, or work constantly only to lose your stuff to a group of people who spend more time in this game. Time + Group = Win. Nothing else works.

Community: The community in this game is, frankly, horrible. It's kind of a domino effect - new player sees a group, group kills him on sight, --> new player learns that game is about getting a group together and killing on sight. It's gotten to the point where maybe 1 in 15 people I see in this game do not kill me on sight, even after stating I'm friendly.

Developers: This is probably one of the main issues with the game, and surprisingly, it's not something I see adressed often in reviews. To me, development of this game has halted. For a game that's reportedly in early alpha" for over 2 years
date: the last thing players want to see is the devs changing the size of rocks and plants and calling that an update. My defintion of developing a game
recommended: espcially one that is in "early alpha" is adding new mechanics

There's also a hacking problem which the developers are trying as hard as they can to ignore. The addition of anti cheat didn't seem to change a thing.

Overall: This game is conceptually flawed

Please read edit for new Rust!!!
First of all, Rust is a great game! Constant updates, and a good community! Overall, I would rate this game 8/10 and definitely recommend it to others!
Now, I shall tell a story!
-Once upon a time, there were these 3 naked men who found M4 rifles and killed everyone within sight. One day, these 3 men decided to kill some annoying child whom was spamming their mic. (We) went and took over his base, finding many resources and, yet another, M4 rifle. We went and found another trustworthy person to base with us. We decided not to kill everyone, only people who were stacked with gear and were killing everyone. We helped a few newbies out and built our base. I chose to build it under a rock cliff so it would look like a cave. While building, we noticed this small crack since there wasn't enough room for another wall. I stuck a barricade (very weak) to keep intruders out. The micspamming kid found our base, and got hackers to kill us. They didn't know that we had beds to respawn in there with. We respawned, got our gear, and started improving the base. They couldn't get in since we had good walls (and didn't notice the barricade). Then, the kid came back with some n00bs claiming they had C4 to break in our base. The chopped and chopped with their rocks at the door, and we just kept building walls behind it so they couldn't get in. Then, they left to go get gunpowder, so we went out the secret exit to get resources. We needed to craft bullets. One at a time, we went outside, making sure it was safe. One guy fell off the cliff and died. The other was mauled by a bear. It was down to me and one other guy. We got all the resources and returned to the base, rebuilding the barricade. We crafted and shared all the bullets. The next day, we were all laughing when that kid came back. I told one friend to break the barricade while I distracted. Then, we all jumped on top of the cliff and reigned fire upon the kid's army. One of or men were shot by friendlies in the crossfire. But then, all of the enemy was defeated. We did it! We returned into the base, went and picked up the fallen ally and returned his gear to him.
-
This game is an amazing game! If you're looking for a fun, survival, multiplayer game- GET THIS!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

well this game has a fun concept.... if it was all equal.... but its not.... there is no actual objective to this game there is not much to do either...

you start off naked (bare butt naked) with a rock. if you start off next to another naked man with a rock i suggest you run! because that naked man will chase you with his rock. from there you need to use your rock on some trees and other rocks to get materials like wood, metal, rock, ect with this you can make more tools to get more resources faster to build yourself a house however you want. the problem here lies is living... and staying alive.. you can die from many things bears, hunger and thurst. the biggest problem is other players..
other players are ***holes they will kill you for your resources most of them have guns and blurprints to make stuff you cant. if you die before you get a bed in your house.. guess what you have to start all over naked with a rock.

if you can manage to get a house up and running with bed furnace some chests to hold your loot put locks on your doors so no one can get in except for you and your friends, your still not safe.. there is C4 that can blow up your house along with rockets grenades and explosives that can destroy the walls of your house.
the object of them doing that is so that they can get your wood, stone, metal, ect so that they dont have to farm for those resources. even if you get your house made of full metal your house is still unsafe! all it takes is rockets for your walls to come crumbling down.

and they take your resources make more rockets to take down your neighbors house.  if your in your house while they are raiding you still have no hope... cause if you open your locked door to try and kill them they have a shotgun waiting for you and your dead and the door is open for them to come in and kill you repeatedly as you spawn and take your ♥♥♥♥....

this game was fun for a while not very long at all tho.. it gets old fast unless you have a large group of friends you can trust.  but when you hear gun shots in the distance you know your ****ed. because even if you try to fight them off and you have a gun.. if you get killed you just gave them a gun and ammo to kill you more with.

it was fun.. but with no objective to fight for it gets super boring super fast.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun Fact:  Go to 0:15 in the trailer, the other guy is me. This trailer was made by Scardigne, the devs thought was good enough to use as the game's main trailer. This shows you how community oriented this game really is.

Rust's Features as of December 2015 (Devblog 88) - Manual Resource gathering.  - Using tools to hit Trees, Ore nodes or Oil Barrels
- Automated Resource gathering. - Building Quarries to mine ore automatically.
- Home Design  - Creativity and strategy are strongly encouraged.
- Tiers of commodities -  Deployables , building materials, armor, weapons, tools, blueprints
- Clothing system - Shirts, Boots, Pants, Bandannas, Balaclavas, Hats
- Devblogs - Devs keep you updated and discuss every major update.
- Community Showcases - Every week, get your work featured for everyone to see!
- Skins system - Workshop, SDK and Steam Market - For Clothing, Weapons and Deployables
- Environmental factors - Weather, Temperature, Dryness, Radiation
- Weapons  - Rifles, Pistols, LMGs, Bows, Crossbows, Spears, Knives, Swords, Maces, etc
- Weapon Attachments  - Silencers, Holographic Sights
- Boss NPCs  - Rewards teamwork (Heavily armed Helicopters)
- Player-built structures are fully destructible to anyone with the tools to do so.
- Slot based Inventory system - Excess must be stored in storage containers.
- Defensive Tools  - Autoturrets, Traps, Mines, Wood Spikes, Spike Barricades, Stone Walls, Wood Walls & Gates
- Offensive Tools - Rocket Launchers, C4 Explosive Charges, Grenades, Explosive Ammo
- Raiding requires planning, strategy and vulnerability assessment.
- Defending requires strategy and damage control proficiencies.
- Ammo types - Incendiary, High Velocity, Explosive, Regular
- Day and Night Cycle - Along with appropriate environmental changes.
- Procedural maps and resource spawns.
- Sign Painting - Show off your work to others!
- Voice chat -  Will make your character's mouth move according to what you say.
- Airdrops - They fall randomly and are nearly always contested due to their high risk high reward status.
- Blueprint system - Collect fragments and upgrade them to better tiers as to reveal better quality blueprints
- Player Death - You lose what you carry/wear when you die, but not the blueprints you have already learnt.
- Physics and projectile physics  - Throwing a rock, spear, hatchet, using a bow, crossbow, firing a gun, etc
- Metabolism - Hunger, Thirst
- Secret Stashes to hide your loot.
- Sleeping Bags spawns - These can be given to friends to ease playing together.
- Freelook  - Look around while doing stuff.
- Fully configurable keybindings
- No combat logging - your character goes to sleep" when you disconnect. You can still be killed and looted.
- Modded and Normal Servers - Choose one depending on your playstyle.

*REMINDER: Features subject to change with each update
date: check http://playrust.com/ for latest information*\n\nGameplay You spawn in with a Torch and a Rock. From there you try to gather as many resources as you can. This is a game in which resources are key so acquiring them by any means necessary is fair game. Yes

Or you can be killed by a guy while you're farming and subsequently lose all your hard work...or kill the guy farming then get killed by another guy. That is why you always want to use move around and look around while farming. To make sure you do not lose all of your resources

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is great and all and so are the Devs, but the way they handled the Legacy Rust from the get-go really left me with regret as most Alpha/Early-Access have. In greater detail my experince was quite an amazing one right up until about 5 months into the life-span of the game, that is of course when the hackers pretty much took over the servers and ruined the game for everybody. During that time there was no real implemented of a anti-cheat but it was heavly being worked on from what we heard, so the only real engagement with the hackers were admins and thier powers, and my gosh that got out of hand too, those who got punked on by cheaters would host thier own servers and abuse admin powers. But I stuck with Rust from day 1, just trying to play the damn game, getting rekkt by hackers everyday losing gear and building supplys having to find a new server every 5 weeks.

That is all until CheatPunch, the anti-cheat they had been working on for so long! Yes finally!(little did I know...)
You might be wondering did the hackers go away?   No.
Did the slow down or atleat stop coming?    Ha, not at all.
Were Admins starting to use powers and not abuse?  It got worse!
Did the Devs do anything to fix it? Not a damn thing.
Was the anti-cheat tested? I don't believe it was.
Did it help anything? Help me see I wasted $20

Infact the anti-cheat is such garbage I got wrongfully banned in the Alpha/Legacy and can no longer play Rust, I thought there must be a mistake and e-mailed FacePunch. After waiting and waiting and emailing several other devs I was told that they can't/won't do anything for me and to buy a new copy on a new steam account. Lol. Right.

After 550+ hours and a hard belif that Garry knew what he was doing because Gmod turned out so well,
gotta wake up and smell the coffee, nobody makes games like they used to.

Wish I never bought this one.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:

- Graphics are pretty nice, runs fairly well on my upper medium rig

- Building a base with some friends, gathering resources and getting blueprints for weapons is very satisfying

- You can occasionally meet someone who won't shoot you on sight, then maybe you'll have a laugh together

- The paintable signs are a great idea and add some much needed personal touch to the world

Cons:

- The community is toxic, ~9/10 people will kill you instantly on sight even if you are a fresh spawn, but whats worse is half of them sound like spoiled 10 yr olds over voip which is extremely annoying

- Logging in and seeing your base and all your stuff completely gone just cos you couldn't play for a day is pretty disheartening, so unless you want to be a 24/7 rusthead then don't bother, all you'll get is frustration time and again.

- Makes you hate the community, turning you into another kill on sight ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cos you're sick of getting shot for no reason, hence the community breeds it's own demise.

- Buggy as all hell eg. losing a valuable item cos it fell through the floor / can't kill a boar cos it glitched through a huge rock

- Hackers (not to name names but cough *russians* cough)

Basically if you want to have a game that you have to dedicate 4 hours a day to AT LEAST then you might enjoy rust, but for me its just a bunch of ♥♥♥♥♥ sitting in their towers shooting everyone they see, only going outside to shoot more people on sight.

Having said that you might want to be one of those people, and it can be really good fun don't get me wrong. I just want you to be a little more knowledgeable about what you're getting with rust, which is what a review should be.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am seeing a lot of negative reviews on this game and I wanted to shed some light to people on the fence about buying this game. I have over 500 hours of gameplay at the moment and I am still currently playing it. This game is a hardcore survival game and I do mean hardcore. Most people you encounter will in fact kill you, even if you are a fresh spawn carrying a rock. However, it's in game voip allows you to communicate with others and I have actually talked my way out of being murdered and my precious rock being stolen  This game is a mix between DayZ and Minecraft. You can farm wood and ore and build up a base and fortify it. You can also craft weapons, gear, explosives and raid other bases and kill people. The reason why I can't give the current version of Rust a 10 is because 1.) Servers rubber band sometimes which makes it a struggle to line up a good shot on people. 2.) They should update it more often. (I know they are rebuilding a new version from scratch at the moment and it's alright so far. There are some bugs like going up up stairs.). 3.) This game can be played solo but it really is built for group play. That being said I have played at least 2/3 of my hours alone and still had a blast. Overall, this game is a time sink and you will be looking at the clock wondering where the time went. If you are a hardcore surival fan. The new version barely has any hackers from what I can tell. So they have fixed that so far.


It's at Alpha but the game already has a decent playable content and a huge player base. Developers are pretty active and they give news about new implementations every week but the updates still take time.


Personally, I love this game. I have given it only 8.5/10 for several reasons though which I will list below.
There is a huge learning curve that accompanies this game, for the first hour or so you may be completely confused on how to play, but that is the same with most games. If you do figure out how to get started quickly, it can take you maybe 30 minutes to get well established with a house etc.  This game is very dependent on a number of factors, including server, friends, and overall attitude.

Some servers that you get on in the game have a hacker. Mostly large servers. It is sometimes a challenge to find a server with good staffing and admins, but once you do, this problem is almost non-existent. If you continue to have issues with it, do some research to find a good server, and try to befriend an admin or two so you know when they are on.

This game is also very heavily group-based. If you find yourself a good set of friends to play with, it deters a lot of people from attacking you, as well as making starting off easier. Try to find some people to play with and your game play will increase tenfold.

I also put attitude here, because you have to be okay with dying. If you have a problem with that it's not the game for you. People try to kill you. That's it. The game is kill or be killed, or hide long enough to get settled. If you cannot get started easily, try to find a friend or two to play with and it makes dying not as unbearable. Also, the friendlier you are to others, the friendlier they will be back to you (usually), with this in mind you can make allies and trade with others, but it all depends on what your mindset in-game is.

This game is not for people accustomed to being spoon-fed by developers. Read that twice, so it sticks. This game is not for people accustomed to being spoon-fed by developers. Read that twice, so it sticks.

Raiding, defending, gathering, animal - hunting, the paranoia of not knowing other player's intentions, Rust will make you feel like you're a survivor. Or it will send you crying back to games where you're told where to go, what to do, and when to do it.


Enjoy.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played Rust more than any other game in my Steam library. It started as one of the best gaming experiences I've ever had, followed by the absolute worst experience I've ever had. Let me explain.

Rust Legacy" (the version previous) was a very fun survival game. You had basic loot gathering
date: a map that took some time to memorize
hoursPlayed: base raiding
voteText: fun PVP combat
helpfulPercent: crafting
votesHelpful: etc. It was not a perfect game
votesTotal: but being "Early Access"
votesFunny: it was easily the best purchase I made in 2014. And then the new "experimental" version was rolled out.\n\nThe developers decided to completely scrap the old engine and do a rewrite from the ground up. I am a developer and I can appreciate this mindset. However
commentsCount:
the new version of Rust is a far cry from what it used to be. The new procedural generated map is a cool idea but it is so incredibly bland. Combat is weird. There are no base raiding mechanics in place other than shooting a player's door down (they've reimplemented raiding with C4). Basic UI features are missing. The new version is an absolute mess and is not very fun at all.

A new player looking at the reviews in Steam may be misled into buying it because of the "Very Positive" rating it currently holds. BE WARNED - Most of those positive reviews are for LEGACY. You can still play the Legacy version but it is now unmaintained and riddled with hackers and the experience just isn't the same. There is also a very large exploit which allows players to get into bases without having to raid and it is widely abused.

It was borderline irresponsible for the developers to push out the old version so quickly and alienate their fanbase. I get that the game is "Early Access" and still has a way to go
column16: but they took a step in the wrong direction and I doubt they will be able to get back to what made this game so special.\n\nEdit on 3/17/2015: raiding is now in place. Game still not as fun as legacy."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Seems like the reviews tell pretty much all there is to tell, so I'll just share a recipe for a Strawberry Banana smoothie:

Ingredients:

-1 Banana
-4 to 8 plump Strawberries
-4 to 6 Ice Cubes
-1 Spoonful of Greek Yogurt (Whatever kind of yogurt works, Greek is just my preferred choice.)
-2/3 Cup of Milk
-1/4 Cub of Water
-1 squirt of Lemon Juice

Instructions:

Put the banana in the blender, preferrably in slices. Proceed to place the strawberries in after that. Next, Chuck the spoonful of yogurt into the blender (minus the spoon, of course). Then, carefully place the ice cubes in on top of the bananas, strawberries, and yogurt. Pour the milk, water, then lemon juice into the blender. Start blending on a low setting to crush the ice, then gradully increase speed until you are content with the smoothness of the drink. Pour into a glass and enjoy!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ever read Lord Of The Flies? Its just like that.
but for more detail...
Good Game, Good Idea, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ community. For example here is the prey chain in rust: You spawn, you have one rock, you kill another fresh spawn for their rock, someone kills you for your two rocks, they then have three rocks, then someone kills them for their three rocks, they then have four rocks, then someone kills them for their four rocks, then the guy with five rocks runs to get wood, then the guy with five rocks is instakilled by someone with a bow. The guy with a bow, burlap clothes, and six rocks gathers wood, Guy with bow, clothes, and six rocks, gathers a rock, the guy with bow, clothes, six rocks, some wood and some stone, is shot by guy with bolt action rifle. The guy with seven rocks a gun and the other guys clothing, logs out for the night. Seven other guys with bolt action rifles break into his house. Steal all his rocks and stuff. Those guys (a clan) contiune to prey on everyone else. My advice: dont buy this game unless you have a group of friends to play with. If you are trying to gain respect, show them your giant rock collection (of the early cycle if you got out). Then respawn cause they killed you for your twenty seven rocks. This game may actually instill you with extreme trust issues that carry on to real life. You may be in the hall way walking to class or a meeting, but the guy behind you IS planning to kill you with his book/breifcase/rock, you just dont know it yet. Trust No One.

In summary: This game is good, the community is toxic, wouldnt buy again.
No seriously I like this game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The quick push to steam really seems like a bit of a cash grab. This game is not ready for steam release, even in early access. I was very interested and devoted a lot of playtime to this early on, but eventually threw in the towel until things are more developed.

The development seems to have priorities all over the place, with every update breaking core components at the same time often adding nearly useless fluff.

The backend server administration is terrible and there is no logging support, rcon is very limited. Line of sight is poor in the Unity engine and you will frequently experience unacceptable stuttering as many structures load in at once.

Overall, I am very disappointed with the development process this far and have given up until things are more developed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After a few dozen times you have been raided, you will start to understand what this game really is about.

Rust will teach you a lot about the futility of materialism: is it really such good news to have half-a-dozen furnaces working day and night, when this means your house will be the target of every raider in the region?

You will also learn to keep a stoic calm during the harshest of times, because no matter how well-off you are, how many weapons you own, or how impenetrable your house is: you can lose everything in minutes, and you will have to rebuild everything more than once. The better you understand that no one or nothing is truly safe anywhere, the more relaxed your play through will be.

The game is updated on a regular basis, and this version is already smooth to play. Never mind the complete wipes, the bugs (that can be an issue in some cases), and an overall rough community, Rust is and will be a great game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I very badly want to love this game. 95% of it is brilliant! One of the best open-world, sandbox-style games I've ever seen. But the 5% of bad is really a game-breaker.

I understand that this is Alpha and will be sticking it out hoping these things get improved. In detail: I LOATHE the lack of protection for logging out. This game penalizes you for sleeping, working, or doing anything else IRL. To be successful in this game you would literally need to replace your real life with it. When you log out you face-plant on the ground much like in the movie Avatar" - leaving your body and everything you're carrying vulnerable to anyone who can get to you. I support that there is no way to completely defend your base from raiders and would never ask for that to be changed
date: but it is utterly soul-crushing to start with absolutely nothing every time you log in.\n\nI understand that this was implemented to prevent "combat-logging"
recommended:
however there are other games that have already solved this problem. Things such as log-out timers have been implemented for ages. Create an active timer counting down from 2 minutes (or another arbitrary time value) and have the character disappear after that time. Provide the same static wait time upon a d/c/alt+f4.

TLDR: Though I love the old-school style punishments for failure this game is TOO punishing. Don't expect to be successful unless you can LITERALLY live within it's world.

P.S.
As a secondary minor issue
hoursPlayed: metal is far too rare given how important it is to the game. More spawns

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A truely amazing game! for an alpha it almost feels like a fully released game very fun to survive with your friends explore and set up a base or home somewhere secluded, and then come the hackers and griefers. Speedhacking, flying, teleporting, spawning thousands of c4 in to lag the server out, spawning with the best imaginable gear, god moded players who leap all around the map and kill all players as fast as possible, when that becomes tiring they simply ddos the server and make it crash, Stay in your home? it'll get blown up and everything that you worked for is gone, Hackers will frequently teleport inside kill you and blow everything you had up. Leave to get supplies? same thing, Log off for the night? expect to log back in with the same thing. Try to hide from them? good luck they know where you are at all times, kill you through solid objects rocks metal walls ect. wanna fight back? expect to only be shot in the head via aimbots

The worst thing of all is the producers have not even awknowledged that this is a problem and have done absolutely nothing to help (besides the case of all servers being ddos'd at once,

Steam anticheat? if you like players banned only after several months of continually doing this then go right ahead and keep telling yourself it works

Hackers banned? They simply generate another game key and hop right back in to do the exact same thing constantly.

In conclusion, the game is amazing and almost feels like an entire completed game even though its only in alpha, admins and private servers would greatly assist the hacking issue and keep it lowered as with hackers around, easily makes this one of the worst games on steam, I will be redownloading at a later date once this issue is taken care of, Truely a waste of several days of my time as well as 40$ to try and enjoy it with some friends.

DO NOT BUY TILL THE HACKER PROBLEM IS AT LEAST AWKNOWLEDGED!

I stumbled towards a campfire, lighting it and dropping my raw chicken breasts on top. My hunger meter was fine, but I'd feel better if I knew I had some rations to fall back on as I travelled.

I decided to walk off and get my bearings while my chicken cooked, taking a quick stroll around the area. I stopped to admire the view of the plains in front of me, the way the grass swayed. The orange tinted sky would have made it look even more beautiful, had I not had the settings on low.

Damn FPS.

I turned back towards my temporary resting spot, surprised to hear a man growling over voice chat, This my chicken!"

He'd already seen me. And he'd attempted to steal my food.

I yelled at him to back away and pulled my hatchet free

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game but be warned it will consume vast quantities of time. Its online crack.

Game is what you see from video`s online and reviews. However its shifting more and more towards high tech weaponry so its not a true survival game set in the wild. It is but its got semi-automatic guns, C-4 and rocket launchers etc.

Game tends to bring out the worst in people and massive QQ from people on chat.

The thing is Rust is really fun but it does take a decent few hours to build a base not to mention gathering resources for guns and so forth. Because of this when people get raided some tend to have a nervous breakdown on Rust chat.

You get to log in and mix with some truely socially dysfunctional people whom display some of the worst online in-game bullying actions and behaviour. One has to sit in awe viewing a screen witnessing such online carnage. Marvelous!

The theme of the fully geared Rust player killing a naked Rust player in KoS (kill on sight) is a political issue online. The nakeds argue its wrong but once a naked is geared most tend to become the KoS`er of nakeds blaming the mental trauma they experienced as a naked in Rust as the reason. Fantastic!

Rust dev team are steering the game towards building towns and trade areas between factions/clans. The community is so against it they rage in forums / steam feedback and generally blow the crap out of every base possible, loot everything and leave the owner QQ`ing on chat in CAPS. Ive even seen a naked bashing a wooden foundation with a bow and arrow repeatedly in a desperate attempt to destroy someones hard worked base and loot all it contains. The community are utter savages.

In Rust its best not to loot random items in certain areas for possible craftable blueprints. If you enter an area like this 99% of the time you will be shot at by fully geared people on safari - shooting nakeds. In fact some tend to build bases in these areas purely for the purpose of pursuing the gentleman sport that is KoS`ing nakeds.

There is no way you will be able to play this game and create a community for long. The barbarisim of the online community beats zombies any-day. You will NOT survive, you WILL die repeatedly and you WILL get robbed. No one is your friend, everyone wants to exploit you. Rust even has an emerging slave trade. Sometimes someone will have a massive QQ  never to return to the server. We dont know if that person died of a heart attack or went to another server. True dat.

This is Rust.

I highly recommend this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I didn't know what to write about in my review, so here's a recipe for pancakes instead:

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon white sugar
1 1/4 cups milk
1 egg
3 tablespoons butter, melted

1. In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg and melted butter; mix until smooth.

2. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You're bad at your job.

You developed one of the few actually playable early-access-survival games twice in a relatively short time and put up some remarkably smooth working content. Yet you completely ignore the fact that your game is only interesting for a couple of hours, since there is no long term motivation attached to anything.

There is no progress to make, base building/attacking is unbalanced as ♥♥♥♥, the game gets boring even for quite autistic people who like to spend literally years in games like this where you can't do much. Greg Tech Fusion Reactors

You use a hopefully sophisticated engine made by one of the large, senior, oldschool game developers on this planet.
Yet you have to reinvent the wheel with a console? Why the hell do you have to even develop anything related to a console? It should be done and working at the second you fire up the engine you licensed.

Why is the netcode so bad? Inventory seems to be server sided, it is laggy as hell and tedious to use. Again, its 2015 and you use a licensed engine, why the hell isnt this better.

Little things. Everything drops wolf meat? Give a ♥♥♥♥ing intern half an hour to copy&paste the classes and rename them for a start. Your artists made some impressive looking stuff, i dont believe some different looking meats will keep them busy for a year.

How about you try a bit more to think from an actual players perspective, and try not to break players progress all the time. give people something to achieve, something to be proud of, something with a tad of permanency that goes beyond a huge base that will be dismantled by some russian guys while you're asleep.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rust is a hardcore, dog-eat-dog, tribal simulator. First, the pros and cons:

Pros    Cons            Build your own base
Destroy other bases!
Lots of exploring, base building and crafting options
Pretty!
Many server mods
Very slow development. Updates are regular but tiny, consisting mainly of tweaks
Very buggy. It's still in Early Access after years of development
Newbie unfriendly
Many cheaters
No effective anti cheat solutions
Regular forced wipes of all servers
Grinding. Lots and lots of grinding

When all goes reasonably well, the game is fun. You build a base, try to secure it properly agaist raiders and go raiding yourself. When you get raided, you can see how they got in and work out how to prevent them doing the same next time. Raiding a base is also great fun - find weaknesses in design, carefully step around the sleeping bodies and search for the cupboard and loot room.

There is, however, a lot of grinding going on. You'll spend most of your time chopping down trees, mining rocks, gathering other resources and playing lottery with blueprints. This is part of the game, but when you spend weeks building a nice base and the developer decides to make a minor update to the map generator algorithm, all servers are forced to wipe their maps, meaning you'll have to start from scratch again for no good reason. Which would be okay if the grinding wasn't such a.. well, grind.

As a newbie, you would do better to watch How to play" videos on youtube first. Learning through playing is slow and tedious. You will get killed
date: a lot. Most people are hostile and will kill you on sight. You'll need blueprints to survive or to make a base that stands a chance of staying in one piece. Just gathering and trying to build a small house from the start will leave you frustrated. It's not until you've gained a lot of blueprints and mastered some of the weapons that you stand a chance of holding your own. Unfortunately
recommended: you'll have to redo this on every server you play
hoursPlayed: and again after every blueprint wipe.\n\nWhen all doesn't go well
voteText: there are cheaters. Many
helpfulPercent: many cheaters. There is no effective server side anti cheat in place
votesHelpful: and no data is server side validated. Which means it's incredibly easy to create and use cheats in this game
votesTotal: and that's exactly what happens. Anything from flying and wallhacks to Godmode
votesFunny: aimbotting and item duping. Some cheaters are blatant
commentsCount: but most are more subtle and require online admins to catch them in the act. Which most servers don't have - especially the official servers. One of the most annoying doubts you'll keep facing is: "Did they cheat? Were they really that good or lucky? Can I retaliate or would that be futile?".\n\nI've enjoyed playing this game
column16: but I've reached a point where I feel development gets in the way of the gameplay
column17: and the many bugs
column18: glitches and cheats just leave me more frustrated than satisfied. I'll try again in a year
column19: maybe two."

Early Access Review

I am sure that the RUST group has been working hard to detect cheaters and ban them, but unfortunately hacking still exists and the players who don't cheat suffer from this.
可以肯定的是RUST游戏组一直致力于对抗挂逼，但不幸的是，挂逼依然存在而且威胁着不开挂的玩家的游戏体验。
I will not agree that RUST is a good game, unless all hackers are banned and never play RUST again.
除非所有挂逼被就地正法，否则我不会同意RUST是一个好游戏。
Now I seriously report a hacker in Official Hong Kong Server, who has been doing everything a hacker can do: auto aiming, run really fast, super jump, see clearly in the dark...most importantly, he has been cheating for over 4000 hrs!
现在我严肃的举报香港官方服务器的一个挂逼，他自动瞄准，瞬移，超级跳，夜视，最重要的是他已经开挂玩了4000小时。
His ID is TOP.
他的ID是TOP。
Everyone in Official HK Server should know his name, for being the greatest hacker of all time.
每一个在香港官服玩过的人都知道这个史上最牛逼大挂逼。
Can you imagine being headshoted 100 times, 10 miles away, by one player?
你能想象被同一个人在十万八千里爆头一百多次吗？
Can you imagine someone who just got killed comes back in 10 seconds?
你能想象一个人刚被射死，10秒以后又回来吗？
How would you feel if your base, which you have been tending for a week, got raided by these hackers?
如果你悉心照料一周的房子被挂逼草掉了，你会怎么想？
WE RE NOT PLAYING THE SAME GAAAAAME!!!!! IT IS NOT FAIR!!!
我们玩的就不是他妈的同一个游戏！这他妈的不公平！

Hope you(Steam and RUST group) can do something about this TOP, and all hackers.
希望你们（Steam和RUST游戏组）能做点事情，关于TOP以及其他所有挂逼。
Guess how many players will agree with me on this?
猜猜会有多少玩家同意我说的？

This game is surely a game worth buying, if there are no hackers.
这个游戏是一个很值得入手的游戏，如果没有挂逼的话。

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before i get into the depth, i want to make sure all who see this review get a warning

DO NOT PLAY IF YOU HAVE HEART CONDITIONS OR A WEAK HEART
The game is uber quiet except for when you get shot, a gunshot is super loud and shocking, even spears are, the screen flashes and your char falls over making sickening death shreiks for a couple of minutes, this game can give you a heart attack and im not saying that as a joke.

I keep trying to get into this game

And every time I do I learn a little bit more about the bad side of every person.

This is a game which purely simulates hatred, a game where the only things to do is hoard things to kill people with then kill people with them.

I never get off this game happy, the only reason i get back on is anger for people who harmed me or the 1 or 2 people who treated me like a person and didnt just kill.

The community is easily the worst, most scum filled of any game, not to say there arent nice people, but if you find them, chances are you will get to witness them get brutally murdered.

Maybe on private servers, maybe, this game is fun, but on anything but a friends server, this is a hatred sim.

...

I kept telling myself that its a survival game, I tried to talk about how real it was and how I play it because its realistic and i enjoy having to redo everything over and over... but that was false.

You will get on this game, despite hating it, because inside every human being is a desire to be hunted, to be scared, to hurt people. You will get on here because it is the modern tragic play, you feel better about yourself if you destroy something someone else spent weeks on.

Rust will show you alot about life, teach you that every movie youve ever seen is a set of circumstances, the hero who pulls through every one unscathed, doesnt exist. maybe one or two close calls, but otherwise they would be dead and forgotten, to put it poetically, you learn that the heroes dont exist, theres just the bad guys in the movies

And we are all, the bad guys.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rust definitely isn't for everyone.  If you're into survival, naked people, and being able to build anything from a small shack to a large compound with very little limitation on HOW you build it, then this game might be for you.

The game throws you into the wilderness with little more than a rock.  Use this rock, to help you gather supplies until eventually you go from that naked guy with a rock, to the dude with a big metal mansion, full armor, and a bunch of guns.

Depending on the server you are in, there might be tons of supplies/materials or very little, and there might be lots of PvP to almost none.  Personally, I enjoy building and hunting so I've found myself a server with lots of materials/supplies and almost no PvP.  For those who want to kill other players though, believe me, it won't be difficult to find a server that caters to you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would love to recommend this game, who wouldn't? It has nice graphics, great gameplay concepts, and an active dev team.

However all is not well in the land of Rust even though many will try and convince you that it is.

The rust general population, not including player owned servers, is insanely toxic, to point of legit psychopaths using this game to grief other people. The game does open up the community to a dog-eat-dog world and honestly I like that it's open to that. I do feel like the developers encourage a toxic atmosphere with the way they interact with the playerbase.

The developers are incessantly abusive, they go out of their way to play jokes on players and give asinine sarcastic answers whenever they do feel like addressing customers. Facepunch is, by far, the least professional, least respectful, and most vulgar company I've had the displeasure of interacting with. I can only assume they feel justified in the way they treat others because a few of their upper level developers have made a name for themselves among gamers by producing a couple of first in their genre-niche" games and think that makes them too valuable or too big to fail. You can tell this ruffles my feathers quite a bit.

The devs are pretty slow on development
date: new features take months and months to push out and bug fixes take a few weeks to a couple of months. Gameplay quality and player feedback aren't a top priority here. The game's supporters like to hide behind the "Alpha" or "early access" tags as if rust were really treated as such. How many unfinished games do you know of with an item shop?\n\nThe rust's graphics are beautiful
recommended: that coupled with fantastic sounds makes it incredibley easy to lose yourself in this game's world. However nothing is immune to the ever present bugs and glitches. Heads warping across the map of dead bodies
hoursPlayed: glacier shadows stretching over mountains
voteText: seeing player shadows through objects
helpfulPercent: the list goes on but you should get the point.\n\nServers are another issue
votesHelpful: with the revenue Rust generates for Facepunch I would expect servers paid for by the developers to be fiscally sounds choices. However more often than not
votesTotal: once a month every single month servers will go down and about 2/3 will take close to 24 hours to come back online or some will never come back. The developers are oddly mute when it comes this. The servers will lag
votesFunny: harshly
commentsCount: and players will rant about how they're being DDOS when it's more likely that Facepunch pays for crap service.\n\nNow don't get me wrong I had fun with Rust. As of writing this I have pretty close to 500 hours. What made it so much fun is what I built and defended with my friends however losing it is harsh
column16: we never reached great heights. We aspired to much and accomplished a fair amount but couldn't compete with those who spend day and night playing in massive groups or against all the hackers who pop up on a regular basis. On top of that there's no end game content theres no goal other than conquer all and kill all. Furthermore

There are bosses in the game which you can build defense items from but again you need a group in order to accomplish that.\n\nI wish this game was better

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt is a very good early alpha game. With that said it is early alpha so a lot of content is missing from whatever product they have envisioned for the full game. That is one of the main reasons why I have to say, don't buy it yet. I was lucky enough to get it for free but overall for the price you are paying there are many completed great games. This game has a great foundation for success, I think it just needs more time to iron out what type of game it wants to be. It seems like it is a poorly mixed group of genres. I put about 35 hours into it and had to stop due to myself feeling as if I hit a plateau in my evolution within the game. Since it is early in its development content isn't the only factor on their minds so it is kind of simplistic as of this moment. Once you are the guy with a decent sized house and a good amount of stockpile there is only so much you can do from that point. The raiding is fun and sense of community is great when you connect with other players from trades and what have you but I felt as if I had beaten" the game. Meaning ran out of things I wanted to do. Obviously you can have multiple servers with new and creative builds and new communities but as of right now I don't want to do that. So I am going to wait for more content and follow the games progression. Now if you just want to support the developers with your money because you love the idea and want to add in its development with ideas and what not than it is definately not a bad buy
date: but as I said there are plenty of titles that are finished and will give you more enjoyment most likely."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll keep this as short and to the point as possible

PROS:
Updated bi-weekly with new content (it feels like free dlc!)
You get to be apart of a games developement (could be a con)
Always changing gameplay and dynamics
A fun mix of gunplay, building and survival
Wonderful community, check the subreddit /r/playrust
Game breaking bugs squashed quickly most of the time
Unity 5 engine alllows for endless possibilities
Facepunch studio is great with communicating with its player base

CONS:
Bi-weekly updates a lot of time introduce bugs
Minor bugs seem to linger through mulitple updates
Game isnt properly optimized which leads to poor and varying preformance
Game favors clans and groups of players, going solo is difficult, especially for new players.

Reguardless of the bugs, its a great game. If you have any interest at all in the game, get it.  I cant tell you how many hours ive lost just playing this game( oh wait yes I can, 497 as of this review).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Quick Review-
Rust is a survival game developed by Facepunch Studios (Rust has been in Alpha/Early-Access since late 2013). In Rust your greatest enemy is other players. Once you join a game, you gather resources to build shelter, weapons, and armor.


-Detailed breakdown review-
Story: Your story is completely unique based on who you play against. I have the regular whiny noob story that depicts the wonderful, positive, and cheerful personalities of the player base. (If you don't care to read about Atratzu's first three deaths: Just skip the story section)

First Death: Atratzu the first ran into the world starry eyed and ready to explore the brand new world of Rust. Too be Atratzu the first, was killed thirty minutes later by someone with a gun.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=496577579

Second Death: Atratzu the second, had no intention of repeating his predecessors mistakes. He quickly gathered materials and tried to loot an air drop. A naked man resembling Adam (Bible joke) ran up and asked to team up. Atratzu the second, was no suck-up and ignored the fellow. 5 minutes later Atratzu the second, was interrogated and promptly killed by Adam's friend... whom naturally, ...had a gun.

Third Death: Atratzu the third was by far the most successful, he joined a server that had just reset, so there was no forecast of raining bullets upon his corpse. He settled up in the corner of the world, discovered how to build a house, and was now happily farming the resources close to him.
One day later he see's several distant figures running towards him. Atratzu the third has no intention of making enemies, because he fights honorably. But as a show of force, he equips his bow and backs away from them. The threat seems to work as the figures back down.
Atratzu the third goes back to mining (keeping them in his field of vision) suddenly he hears the whistle of a spear sailing by! Thankfully Atratzu the third had learned how to use the bow and successfully killed one of the attackers. Unfortunately he was overcome by adrenaline and couldn't finish off the other attacker.
Atratzu the third was murdered but respawned at his base, and heard the “patter patter” of footsteps outside his base. Upon hearing the “CHUNK, CHUNK” noises of a forced assault at his door, he exclaimed “Really? Really impressive, three of you vs one of me?” The attacker had the audacity to say “You shouldn't have attacked us you little {obscenity}, now we're going to take your stuff”.
There was no justice, there was no defense, there was no time to craft armor and weapons the thugs beat down Atratzu the thirds door, and killed him in cold blood. No armor, no bow, no defense, there was but one thing he thought when he faded into the dark abyss... “I'm not playing this game by myself anymore”.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=496967985

Gameplay: Here's a good tip for anyone planning on getting this game, look up a PvE server first, you'll have much more time to learn the game. Many people will still be insolent, your base will be raided, but at least you won't need to deal with mass noob genocide.
I recommend reading a guide too, if you want to get into the game faster. I fancy myself a quick learner, but I couldn't figure out how to build anything aside from the default platform with the blueprints.
(Tip: Remember that with certain items... holding down the right mouse buttons give you more options. So to change what your blue prints do, hold down the right mouse button. Saved you an hour of experimenting.)
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=497000410

There is a lot that could be said about how the game works functionally, however the last detail I would like to highlight, is that you can play the “Legacy” version of Rust. (and that's what I'll be playing with my friends who already own the game) The Legacy version doesn't have as many flashy GUI (Graphical User Interface) elements, but functionally and fundamentally seem to be mostly the same to me.
I'm sure people who avidly play Rust have a stronger opinion on Legacy vs Experimental, but to someone who plays more passively, the difference it mostly aesthetic.

Achievements: There are no steam achievements for Rust, Thankfully. Don't add any, I don't want anything to do with that nonsense.

Price: Rust is priced at $19.99, if you can get started in the game (cough cough, get a gun, cough cough), you can easily pump hundreds of hours into this game, by defending your base, your items, and your loot.

Conclusion: This game is not for me.
I genuinely have a distrust for strangers, but I don't want to raid other players, I don't take gleeful delight in making someone else miserable.
I DO delight in defending my base, I DO enjoy challenge, and I DO enjoy playing games with other people. But all in all this game caters more for people who enjoy taking advantage of others. I'm sure I'll play more Rust with friends, but my solo days on Rust are very much over. Everyone I met is too aggressive, too vulgar, and dishonorable.
I recommend this game to people who enjoy constant struggle and competition with other players, have thick skins, time to burn, enjoy raiding other players, enjoy defending their own bases, or want to experience humanity's worst.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOf the games like this, DayZ, 7 Days, etc. this is the best. But there is a fundamental flaw with this type of game which is that unless you plan on playing 24 hours per day, everything you do will be for nothing. Your base will be raided when you log off, regardless of whether it takes a few hours, few days, few weeks. There is nothing you can do to stop it. This would be fine if it didn't take so much time and effort to build a base. Also, even if you do make a nearly unraidable base, a hacker will eventually screw you over anyway. All in all, this is basically just a deathmatch FPS with some crafting thrown in.

Hello dear gamers I'll try to be simple as much as I can so im stick with the pro and cons. (sorry for my bad english)

Short Version:

Pro:
+Graphics,Art,Visual.
+Environment,Atmosphere
+Interesting game/building mechanics, Fairly complex crafting system
+Weekly updates less or more.

Cons:
-Time consuming grinding
-Immature bad community(not just in rust) !!!
-Exploiting rock base building
-Bad Anticheat protecion
-Less cooperative/friendly but more agressive/fighting players.
-Game in alpha state (less content) but its still OK
-No offline mode to practice

Pros Long:

The game looks nice with the new version and yes it has requirements but my mid-end PC can run the game well on max settings. It has the atmosphere and I like the game visual style. The game has potential in almost every aspects. I have to say I like this game even it is in unfinished state. You can spend time in game dont worry.

Cons Long:

As I said Rust has potential BUT GUYS we all know that potential is a waste if you don't use its power I don't say Rust is going that way but its on the edge in my opinion. The game has the same hardcore system like DayZ,WarZ if you die you'll loose everything and respawn elsewhere with the rock and torch (Your learned recipies remains right now its very good at least) this mechanic is good if you like this kind of hardcore elements BUT Rust doesnt support any peacefull action, only the outlaws can win and this is frustrating because you'll loose if you dont shoot everything on sight and it force you to don't trust other players. MY main problem is not in the game itself but the bad people and yes the game creates a playground for them and you'll be the toys. I'm not antisoical or emo I'm a normal man but guys there are a lot of mentally damaged gamers with serious problems they are just looking for conflicts and bully. This is just a game but how you act thats a portion of you. I like action and shooting elements but there are just KILLING without reason and no peace or nice communication now it's just a shooter where you loose every stuff. I built a base with almost fully upgraded defense far from everyone and it didn't last 1 night when i went to sleep and I put like 10+ hours to build it. And listen guys it's good that I can loose but they didn't just break in (dunno how easily) and robbed my base which is OK but they searched for my spawnpoints and destroyed it for what reason do they need that for survive or what? Nah this is about just f*ck with each other for no reason to hurt someone. Games are for fun but games can be for adults as well but immature people cannot handle the power when they have a chance to shoot or not shoot a naked guy who means no harm just running around survivng the elements they will shoot you like a dog because it's fun for him for no reason. If you are normal guys with less time you will get bored/mad so lads we are living a modern stone age where you kill just for fun Rust is a nice mirror what reflects the connection between people and very sad that the player base like 80% d*ckheads 10% just running away from you when you are talking to them and the rest 10% is normal who you'll never meet it's pretty bad ratio I'm sad. There are cheaters as well I met with only 1 that's not much but on offical servers it's bad. Also you have to grind and run/look for resources in the game it was obvious. Be a better community guys c'mon and have a nice time!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

No Direction
As of this writing, I don't recommend this game. Not because of the community, not because of the graphics or sound, not because of the features.

The only reason I don't recommend this game is because the developers took the game from a  community-based survival sandbox  (i.e. Rust Classic) to a  Survival FPS.

I have  a number of interesting stories and enjoyable experiences stemming from Rust Classic. It had a certain magic to it. At the time, no one really understood the game too much and the game wasn't so focused on FPS. With threats ranging from zombies, wildlife, radiation, and hunger, you could work with people and create a group of players all struggling to survive. When I played, I tended to be more diplomatic - and you could do that in Rust Classic. See what each player's about, build alliances" with certain people
date: while defending said alliances when necessary. At one point
recommended: my house was a meeting spot for a good part of the community I played on. People could go to my place to make trades and meet up
hoursPlayed: knowing they wouldn't be shot at unless they came across the wrong way. At one point the community we created was so tight
voteText: that when a band of raiders started attacking people's homes
helpfulPercent: a domino effect occurred. An all-out war across the server sprung up. Some people died and lost everything
votesHelpful: however the bandits were hit hard and lost their explosives. It easily ranked as one of my tensest and most enjoyable times while playing a video game.\n\nThe gameplay now doesn't seem to get like that anymore. It could just be how I'm playing nowadays

but my experience with the game has become solitary due to the nature of the current state of the game.

No sense of direction from the developers.

While they keep improving and updating the game

They've improved the graphics a lot. It's beautiful. You'd think that they'd make it a harsh environment with aggressive wildlife to complement it

I've played this game when it first came out and play still today... My experience has largely stayed the same. There's no venturing into new territory for this game. Because they don't want to try something new within Rust and stick with improving features already present

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rust is yet another disappointment among many titles with early access.  What they give you is an unfinished game, and then they rake in the cash.  Following the release of the game, two things usually happen:

1.  The game is neglected.  Substantial changes are not made to the game, and the developers refuse to fix things that need to be fixed in the game that would make the game that much more enjoyable (DayZ, for example).

2.  The game is redone over and over again.  New core mechanics are implemented into the game, so that by the time the game is finished or drastically reworked,  It is not even the game that you paid for.

Rust is a game that had so much potential.  I had so much fun with the old rust, but randomizing maps makes it so that it is more difficult to find your friends, so the fun is lost.  Gary had a vision for what this game was going to be, and I commend him for making a game that he wants to make, rather than something that the fans want.  You have the freedom to make whatever game you want, but since I invested in a completely different game, can I have my money back?

reviewerDisplayName: D A N I E L
reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review was taken from my early game experience

I awoke on some Strange Island, I had a Rock and a Torch ( Flaming one )
I hit some trees with my Rock and beat up some Bigger rocks to get Stone and metal, I found Cloth plants and made a bow, Then started Hunting.
Killed 2 or 3 Stags and got Raw Chicken Breasts from them as well as: Leather,more cloth, bone Fragments and Animal fat.
I decided to find a town/looting place. Heading alongside a Mountain and I look into the Forest and Whats this ?
A strange army green box was there. It was a Airdrop.
I looted a Bolt action rifle ( with 2 Bullets) and a SMG ( with 6 Bullets) I thought that these would come in handy.
I found some big broken Satellites and decided to loot. Found no loot and it was getting dark. I heard a noise and hid in some Small metal room and waited... I ran out and fled for the hills but came back at Dawn. I hit a barrel and ran away, It did not explode so I beat it up and it game me loot ! I went around hitting all the barrels I could find and soon I had: a Crossbow, Salvaged Ice Pick and some blueprint fragmets, Lots of those ! I then thought that I will build a base, I built a 2x2 block wooden base with a wall 1 wall high and I furnished my base with a Forge and set some metal to forge. While the Forge was doing its magic I went around and found more barrels to smash. I went back to base and found that my forge was empty. I went back to busting up barrels but then... I found ... candy bars... on the floor in bags... I took those like a little child, Eating food on the floor ! I then was heading back to base and I stoped to cheak my inventory but was interrupted by a Golden light and a Loud noise. They had come. Bandits. I ran to a Bush while I was being shot and the Shooting stopped... I pulled out my SMG and waited , I man came and looked at me , I knew what Rust players were like and I thought that I would rather Defend my homeland or die trying so I pulled the trigger and let off my 6 bullets like a mad man, all missing his head, I waited for a few secounds and I was on the floor crying for help and I died. I respawned by my sleeping bag that I had hidden in the bush and I saw them, I ran to the base and closed my door... My door would protect me but no... they just opened it like a civilized person would, I screamed into my mic Please don't kill me ! They then said ok Daniel is friendly, game me back my Bolt action rifle and a random Pipe shotgun and left... I went back to my base and logged out. Rust is Unpredictable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rust is a hard review to write. This game is a blast to play with friends, yet it falls short on the community. You'll spent hours, if not, days, collecting supplies for your base, to be raided by some players who have used an exploit. It's also common for people with weapons to run around killing those who have freshly spawned, and to see people 'act' as frendly fresh spawns, just to pull a gun on you when you act friendly back at them.

For me, that's where the community falls short. There's no 'honor among thieves', or even just common courtesy. There's a line between killing someone because they have good stuff, and killing someone to just tick them off, and in Rust, there doesn't seem to be that line. A few players find it amusing to place a wooden wall in front of any and all entrances to your base, making it impossible to enter/leave without C4, and that stuff is pretty hard to get hold of until late in the game. It only takes a handful of trolls, griefers and just down right mean people to ruin a server for the rest of the players.

At the moment, I don't recommend the game as it is in early alpha; yet, if they were to focus more on the actual survival aspect of the game, and not the whole who has the gun
recommended: then I would be happy to reccomend the game.\n\nI also hear they will be removing military guns
hoursPlayed: which I fully endorse

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well it's about a month and a half now from my last review.

So here it is I played for several hours after the 200mb update. What I can say about it?

-Lag was significantly been improved meaning I don't feel much lag now compared from last month

-Improved AI for animals. Way better than before since now it attacks you continuously but still need more improvement on their movements and how they attack.

-Clothing is still the same it doesn't help you from radiation or probably they will come up with something for that.

-The best part of it is the reworked of buildings. This for me is a very huge update and I can totally say there putting a lot of work on it. The pie selection is great. The demolish building concept is superb and how you upgrade your house has been rebalanced which is really great since you need a lot of resource to upgrade your house and instead of you hammering your house to death just to get it upgraded you only need to hit it a few times and it will automatically upgrade itself on it’s on. Really cool concept if you ask me.

-One major idea that they added is the tool cupboard. This item basically prevents other people to build structure near your house in a certain meter. This for me is one of the best idea that they come up with since it prevents trolls from putting walls in front of your door or building stairs to get up on your house.

It’s still not recommended for me since bugs are still noticeable but this was a great update and I can see that there’s a huge improvement from before. I’ll wait for more updates and will edit my review base on whatever they came up with. For now, kudos for Garry for this great update.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, ive just spend the past 15 minutes reading up on the comments that has been made so far. I find it very surprising that there is that many negative comments about this game. But if you take a second look you will realise that the majority of the comments, are people who is comparing the new rust with the old rust (i played both). And the matter of the fact is that it is two different games. if you would ask me to review the old rust, i would tell you that i personally got fed up spending days, running in and out of rad towns, cause that is all there were to do. The new rust on the otherhand is more about creative thinking. its more about playing it smart. Consider yourself being left behind enemy territory. if you saw a guy in a uniform, could you honestly say that you would run towards him waving your arms, and not expect him to shoot you? Like i said, play it smart, stay in the shadows. When you have set your base up, and you've catched your breath that is when the fun starts. there are endless possibilities when it comes to building a base, just keep in mind, the flashier you make it, the stronger it has to be! if you consider to buy Rust, here is my advice for you.
1. DONT TRUST ANYONE
2. convince your friends to join you
3. stay in the shadows until you are set up.
4. at the end of the day, if you have more kills than deaths, you are doing alright!

honestly, the game is alot more fun if you find a couple of people to play it with. i met my crew ingame, so there are nice people around aswel!

i would give this game 10/10  and i would recommend this to everyone aslong as you have just a tiny bit of patience, this isn't counterstrike.
